pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #8642

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Should we provide an instance of `MulOpposite` or something like that?

> Should we provide an instance of `MulOpposite` or something like that?

The generous interpretation of this I think is `reverseHom : Language X ->+* MulOpposite (Language X)`
I have no idea what `->+*` means. Can I proceed as it is?
It's `RingHom`, typed when I didn't have access to `â†’`.
Looks complicated. Can we proceed without the instance?

It wouldn't be an instance, it would be a def. One nice bonus of having the def is that it makes it a little easier to prove that `(x ^ n).reverse = x.reverse ^ n`.

To get you started, you'd want `toFun x := .op (reverse x)`.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8642~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

maintainer merge

Once again, I pushed a few changes at the end, so please take one final skim
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by eric-wieser.
I'm going to push some minor golfs today.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7507015710/job/20439685386)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7507015710/job/20439685161)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7507015710/job/20439684960)

This generally looks good, thanks!

Can you mention `reverse` in the module docstring?

```suggestion
lemma reverse_mul : (l * m).reverse = m.reverse * l.reverse := by
```

```suggestion
lemma reverse_add : (l + m).reverse = l.reverse + m.reverse := by
```
This one and the one above should be `simp`
Can you also add the non-simp lemma `mem_reverse_iff : a âˆˆ l.reverse â†” ...`
Also good simp lemma

I would guess there are some tricks to make the proof from here a lot shorter; for instance rewriting the existential through some lemma about involutive functions, and how `map f` is involutive if `f` is.
Can you be more concrete please?
You'll need the lemmas from #8642
Did you just create a whole PR in order to simplify my proof?
Yes, but also because I think those lemmas should exist.
The outline will be to rewrite by `List.reverse_involutive.list_map.surjective.exists` or similar to reverse the `L` that is being quantified over.
OK, I'll wait for #8642 to be merged.
I pushed a golf
I'm happy with this change, but just because the commit message leaves room for doubt: this make no difference to whether the arguments are explicit, and is solely a stylistic change.
Absolutely. I just think most of us agree that `variable` should not be used for explicit arguments.

```suggestion
/-- `Language.reverse` as a ring isomorphism to the opposite ring. -/
```
Those two should be simp
It's not an hom, it's an equiv!
@eric-wieser
Guilty!
Those two should be simp too

This makes more sense as
```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma mem_reverse : a âˆˆ l.reverse â†” a.reverse âˆˆ l := Iff.rfl

lemma reverse_mem_reverse : a.reverse âˆˆ l.reverse â†” a âˆˆ l := by
```
See eg [`Set.mem_inv`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Pointwise/Basic.html#Set.mem_inv)

```suggestion
  aesop
```
hopefully?
Nope.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Language reversal
